documentation.text:
@title ChessCore - Main chess game logic
 @notice Inherits from ChessBoard and implements move validation and game state
@notice Offer a draw to the opponent
@notice Accept a draw offer from the opponent
@notice Claim victory when opponent has not moved within timeout period
@notice Check if a move would leave the current player's king in check
@notice Check if the path is clear for castling (squares between king and destination must be empty)
@notice Pure view validation - does NOT modify any state (used for check detection)
@notice Validates move and updates rook moved flags when rook moves
@notice Build a comment string for the move event (simplified for size)

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Only white player can setup board"

arguments.value: Only white player can setup board

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Only white player can setup board"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Can only setup before game starts"

arguments.value: Can only setup before game starts

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Can only setup before game starts"

documentation.text:
@notice Setup function for testing - place a piece on the board
 @dev Only callable by white player before game starts (before black joins)

returns.blackBlocksRemaining: Blocks remaining before black times out (0 if not their turn)
returns.whiteBlocksRemaining: Blocks remaining before white times out (0 if not their turn)

acceptDraw().notice: Accept a draw offer from the opponent

claimVictoryByTimeout().notice: Claim victory when opponent has not moved within timeout period

getBoardState().notice: Get entire board state in a single call (saves 63 RPC calls)

getTimeoutStatus().notice: Get timeout status for both players

offerDraw().notice: Offer a draw to the opponent

printBoard().notice: Print board as string (deprecated - use getBoardState)

printChessBoardLayoutSVG().notice: Get SVG representation of the board
